name: ending illegal logging
details: the federal government should introduce legislation to end illegal logging and prevent the importation of timber that has been illegally harvested.

name: protecting threatened forest and bushland habitats
details: the federal government should protect threatened forest and bushland habitats from logging.

name: banning new thermal coal mines
details: the federal government should put a ban on new thermal coal mines opening in Australia

name: increasing marine conservation
details: the federal government should introduce legislation and regulations that protect and conserve Australia's marine ecosystems such as the Great Barrier Reef

name: protecting the Great Barrier Reef
details: the federal government should make laws and regulations that protect and conserve the health of the Great Barrier Reef for future generations

name: landholders' right to say no to mining and gas exploration
details: landholders, particularly farmers, should be able to say no to mining and gas exploration on their land (in other words, they should be able to lock the gate)

name: increasing government support for the dairy industry
details: the federal government should increase their support of Australia's dairy industry by, for example, regulating increased milk prices

name: live animal export
details: the federal government should allow live animal export and place minimal restrictions on it

name: investing in climate science
details: the federal government should invest in climate science to ensure that Australia is best equipped to deal with the challenges of climate change

name: building community climate change resilience
details: the federal government should invest in efforts to increase community resilience to extreme weather events, such as bushfires and floods

name: maintaining or increasing CSIRO funding
details: the federal government should maintain or increase the amount of funding allocated to the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO)

name: carbon farming
details: the federal government should introduce a carbon farming initiative that encourages the farming and timber industries to decrease carbon emissions or to increase carbon storage (known as carbon sequestration)

name: technology neutral emission reduction targets
details: the federal government's policies to reduce Australia's greenhouse gas emissions should be "technology neutral", which means all forms of electricity generation should be on the table, including coal with carbon capture and storage and gas

name: nuclear energy
details: the federal government should support nuclear energy generation in Australia

name: Australia's timber industry
details: the federal government should protect Australia's logging industry and the jobs it represents

name: Adani's proposed Carmichael coal mine in the Galilee Basin
details: the federal government should support the Adani Group's plans to build the Carmichael mine in Queensland's Galilee Basin

name: MacMines' proposed China Stone coal mine in the Galilee Basin
details: the federal government should support MacMines' plans to build the China Stone coal mine in Queensland's Galilee Basin

name: increasing investment in the coal industry
details: the federal government should maintain or increase its investment in and support for the Australian coal industry

name: unconventional gas mining
details: the federal government should allow companies to mine coal seam (CSG), tight and shale gas

name: offshore oil mining
details: the federal government should support offshore petroleum mining by, for example, granting exploration and drilling licences

name: uranium export
details: the federal government should support the exportation of uranium from Australia

name: Cheaper, efficient, clean power generated locally and sometimes owned by the community.
details: The Commonwealth create an agency with State and Local Government advisors to process renewable energy projects initiated by local communities to supply their energy needs and store or sell surplus. Depending on the environment this could be energy generation from solar, wind or other sustainable projects. New jobs would be generated for local residents to train and maintain systems with the foresight of creating long-term opportunities for young people.

name: a fast transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy
details: in light of the threat of climate change, the federal government should make as rapid a transition to renewable energy as possible

name: increasing funding for road infrastructure
details: the federal government should provide more funding for road infrastructure

name: public transport
details: the federal government should increase funding for public transport within and between Australia's major urban centres and prioritise it over funding for private transport infrastructure projects

name: high speed rail on the east coast
details: there should be a high speed rail network connecting the major cities on the east coast of Australia

name: a carbon price
details: the federal government should introduce a carbon pricing mechanism

name: the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme
details: the federal government should introduce the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme, which is a cap-and-trade system of emissions trading introduced by the Rudd Labor Government

name: an emissions reduction fund
details: the federal government should introduce an emissions reduction fund so it can buy domestic greenhouse gas emissions reductions and offsets by reverse auction. This is a key part of the Coalition Government's Direct Action policy.

name: treating government action on climate change as a matter of urgency
details: the federal government should address the causes and consequences of climate change as a matter of urgency by, for example, lowering emissions and investing in science and technology

name: letting environmental groups challenge the legality of certain government decisions
details: environmental and conservation groups should be able to challenge the legality of federal government decisions made under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999 (EPBC Act) (in other words, they should have standing to seek judicial review under that Act)

name: a plebiscite on the carbon pricing mechanism
details: the federal government should hold a plebiscite to gauge whether citizens support or oppose introducing a carbon pricing mechanism (also known as a 'carbon tax')

name: addressing sea level rise as a matter of urgency
details: the federal government should take urgent action to address the issue of rising sea levels

name: the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA)
details: the federal government should fund and maintain the Australian Renewable Energy Agency, or ARENA, as an independent body that manages the government's renewable energy programs

name: the Paris Climate Agreement
details: the federal government should amend its laws and policies to meet the objectives of the Paris Climate Agreement
